content: **update ** here s melt the ice badge version 1 2 with the purl row shenanigans corrected and 2 sets of instructions for either easy-peasy or fancy-schmancy a tiny knitted symbol of solidarity based on the nisse hat - a pointy red hat with a tassel that was worn by norwegians as a sign of solidarity against the nazis in wwii there are several versions of the melt the ice hat on ravelry i suggest you check them out and make one but if you re not a hat person this little melt the ice badge is for you this project is perfect for using up yarn scraps - not more than 8 or 9 yards are required use whatever needles match your yarn and your preferred gauge it s a gauge-agnostic pattern for the badge in the photo i used dk weight yarn and size 6 needles - two dpns are all you need for this one the pattern does not include a method for fastening it to your clothing how you pin it is up to you i do suggest placing your pin where the point of the hat and the tassel meet to keep your top-heavy badge from flopping over
